Robust Engineering
Using Science, Statistics, and Critical Thinking to improve product design robustness

Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Testing data shape, continuous data
Are the data normally distributed? Normality Test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> Normality Test data are normal data are not normal
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Comparing data spread, continuous data
Comparison of amount of spread (standard deviation) between 2 or more groups of normally distributed data Test For Equal Variance, Bartlett's (or F) Test Stat --> ANOVA --> Test For Equal Variances variance (standard deviation) for all groups are the same at least one of the group's variance (standard deviation) is different than the others
Comparison of amount of spread (standard deviation) between 2 or more groups of non-normally distributed data Test For Equal Variance, Levene's Test Stat --> ANOVA --> Test For Equal Variances variance (standard deviation) for all groups are the same at least one of the group's variance (standard deviation) is different than the others
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Comparing data central tendency, continuous data
Comparing group average of one group of data to a standard, normally distributed data 1-Sample t test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> 1-Sample t mean group 1 = standard mean group 1 not = standard
Comparing group average (mean) between two groups of data, normally distributed data 2-Sample t test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> 2-Sample t mean group 1 = mean group 2 mean group 1 not = mean group 2
Comparing group averages (means) between three or more groups of data, normally distributed data One Way ANOVA test Stat-->ANOVA-->One-Way [or One-Way (Unstacked)] mean group 1 = mean group 2 = mean group 3 at least one of the group's mean is different than the others
Comparing median of a group of data to a standard, used for non-normal data 1-Sample Wilcoxon test Stat --> Nonparametric --> 1-Sample Wilcoxon median is no different than the standard median is different than the standard
Comparing median of two groups of data, used for non-normal data Mann-Whitney test Stat --> Nonparametric --> Mann-Whitney median group 1 = median group 2 median group 1 not = median group 2
Comparing median of three or more groups of data, used for non-normal data Mood's Median test, for when distribution of each group's data has similar shapes Stat --> Nonparametric --> Mood's Median median group 1 = median group 2 = median group 3 at least one group's median is different from the others
Comparing median of three or more groups of data, used for non-normal data Kruskal-Wallis Median test, for when distribution of each group's data has different shapes Stat --> Nonparametric --> Kruskal-Wallis Median Test median group 1 = median group 2 = median group 3 at least one group's median is different from the others
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Comparing data proportions, from counts, attribute data
Proportion of one group of data compared to a standard 1 Proportion Test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> 1 Proportion group proportion = standard group proportion not = standard
Proportion of one group of data compared to a second group's proportion 2 Proportion Test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> 2 Proportion group 1 proportion = group 2 proportion group 2 proportion not = group 2 proportion
Comparing dependencies in groups/levels [proportion test of two or more groups of two or more levels] Chi-Square Test Stat --> Tables --> Chi-Square Test data are independent (not related); proportions are the same data are dependent (related); at least one proportion is different from another
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Correlation & Regression
Is the data correlated? Correlation Test Stat --> Basic Statistics --> Correlation data is not correlated data is correlated
Testing regression model for significance in session window output after running Regression Stat --> Regression --> [multiple choices from here] model does not explain significant variation model does explain significant variation
Testing constant for significance in session window output after running Regression Stat --> Regression --> [multiple choices from here] constant [y-intercept] is zero, it has no significance (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing terms for significance in session window output after running Regression Stat --> Regression --> [multiple choices from here] term does not have significance, does not help explain the variation present term has significance and does explain the variation present
Test of model fit Lack of Fit test under Regression Options Stat --> Regression --> Regression --> Options model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
DOE
Testing the constant for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design constant is zero, not significant (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing Main Effects for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design no Main Effects are significant at least one Main Effect is significant
Testing 2-Way Interactions for significance (or n-Way) in Session window output after running DOE analysis and model includes higher order terms Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design no n-Way interactions are significant at least one n-Way interaction is significant
Testing specific terms for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design term is not significant term is significant
Testing for curvature in Session window output after running DOE analysis, center points exist and are included in the model Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design curvature is not significant curvature is significant
Testing Blocks for significance in Session window output after running DOE analysis, blocks exist and are included in the model Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design no significant difference associated to blocks a significant difference can be attributed to blocks
Testing for Lack of Fit Minitab will run this test when insignificant terms are removed from the model and sufficient degrees of freedom are available Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Factorial Design model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
Practical situation being evaluated Tool Command Sequence Ho Ha
Response Surfaces
Testing the constant for significance in Session window output after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design constant is zero, not significant (or not zero and not significant) constant is not zero, it has significance
Testing Linear terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design no Linear terms are significant at least one Linear term is significant
Testing Square terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design no Square terms are significant at least one Square term is significant
Testing Interactions for significance in Session window output after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design no Interactions are significant at least one interaction is significant
Testing specific terms for significance in Session window output after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design term is not significant term is significant
Testing for Lack of Fit in Session window after running analysis Stat --> DOE --> Analyze Response Surface Design model has 'No Lack Of Fit', model passes this adequacy test model has 'Lack Of Fit', model is inadequate
